business.headline: Supreme Court rules Tiger Global must pay tax on $1.6 billion Flipkart dealThe top court ruled that Tiger Global is not entitled to claim tax exemption under the India–Mauritius Double Taxation Avoidance Agreement (DTAA). It agreed with the Income Tax Department's view that the structure used for the transaction was aimed at avoiding tax liability in India.

Budget 2026: Edtech and adtech seek policy support for AI-led growthWith artificial intelligence playing a growing role in education and digital advertising, industry leaders are looking to Budget 2026 for policy measures that support innovation, skills development and sustainable growth.

India and EU inch closer to finalising trade deal: ReportSenior European Union leaders are set to attend India's Republic Day celebrations on January 26, followed by the India–EU Summit on January 27, where the trade deal is expected to be a key topic.

Budget 2026: Is the old income tax regime slowly on its way out?As Union Budget 2026 draws closer, taxpayers are wondering whether the old income tax regime is nearing a phase-out. While it still exists today, many are questioning whether continued policy support for the new regime signals a gradual discontinuation of the old one.

Can Budget 2026 turn household gold into economic growth?India holds a vast amount of gold in households, much of which remains unused for economic activity. As Budget 2026 approaches, experts believe the government has an opportunity to turn this idle wealth into a driver of growth.

Can Budget 2026 unlock the next phase of India's clean energy transition?With targeted actions from the upcoming Union Budget, India's energy sector could move beyond capacity building and towards more reliable, flexible, and competitive clean power for industrial and commercial consumers nationwide.

For a local poll? Zerodha CEO slams poor planning as markets shut for BMC electionNithin Kamath's comments come on a day when Dalal Street is closed after the Maharashtra government declared January 15 a public holiday to ensure smooth polling for local body elections.

Waiting for BCCL shares? Check your allotment status, expected profit hereBCCL shares: The allotment status is now available, and investors can check whether they have received shares in the first mainboard IPO of 2026, which saw massive demand during the subscription period.
BSE, NSE holiday: Is stock market open or closed for trading today?Indian stock markets will remain closed for a total of 16 days in 2026. January 26 will be the next market holiday this month.

Budget 2026: Will tax reforms and clearer rules revive India's crypto market?With the Union Budget 2026 around the corner, the virtual digital asset sector is hoping for changes that can ease taxation and provide regulatory certainty. Experts believe this could reignite growth in India's crypto ecosystem.

Wholesale inflation rises to 0.83% in December as prices firm upFood prices showed mixed trends during the month. Wholesale food inflation remained flat in December, compared with a sharp 2.6% decline recorded in November.

Trust, targets and commissions: How senior citizens are trapped by mis-sold insuranceHandcrafted ByOur Editors Senior citizens walk into banks seeking safety and certainty. Too often, they walk out with complex insurance products that quietly put their savings and peace of mind at risk.

Budget 2026: What real estate sector expects on housing, tax relief and infraWith the Union Budget 2026 around the corner, real estate developers are hoping for policy steps that improve affordability, simplify taxes and strengthen urban infrastructure to support long-term growth.

Buying an LIC policy? Here's where your money goes and what you get backWith assets under management of over Rs 57 lakh crore, LIC is not just an insurance company but also one of India's biggest long-term investors.
Sensex ends 245 points lower, Nifty below 25,700; TCS down 2%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 244.98 points to close at 83,382.71, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 66.70 points to end at 25,665.60.

US targets Iran trading partners with 25% tariff: Will India be impacted?Markets in India have turned cautious as investors assess whether stricter US penalties on countries trading with Iran could have a spillover impact on Indian exporters, oil trade and overall market sentiment.

When can you withdraw 100% of your PF money? EPFO rules explainedWithdrawing your provident fund money has often felt complicated for many employees. Recent changes by EPFO now clearly explain when members can withdraw their full PF balance.

Will Budget 2026 simplify tax rules for investors?As policymakers prepare Budget 2026, tax experts and investors are hoping for tax changes that make savings and investments simpler, fairer and more predictable.

HIP, TIP before SIP: Experts take on smart financial planningMany investors focus on SIPs to build wealth, but experts say protection should come first. Health and term insurance can safeguard savings and ensure long-term financial plans stay on track during emergencies.

Affordable housing is shrinking in India. Can Budget 2026 fix the problem?Industry experts warn that India is heading towards a divided housing market. Can Budget 2026 bridge the growing gap between luxury and affordable homes?

entertainment.headline: O'Romeo: Check out Shahid-Triptii's chemistry in Hum To Tere Hi Liye song poster The first look for the romantic song 'Hum To Tere Hi Liye The' from the film 'O'Romeo' has been unveiled. The new poster hints at Shahid Kapoor and Triptii Dimri's unrequited romance.

Thalaivar Thambi Thalaimayil review: Jiiva's heartfelt satire wins with warmthRelease Date:Thu Jan 15, 2026 Thalaivar Thambi Thalaimaiyil movie review: Directed by Nithish Sahadev, the political satire starring Jiiva, Thambi Ramaiah and Ilavarasu is a realistic drama that's harmless and full of heart. It brings forth how human egos affect the lives of their loved ones.

Varun Dhawan mocks his own meme during Border 2 promotion, fans join the fun Varun Dhawan, while promoting his upcoming film Border 2, turned internet jokes and criticism into engaging moments. Border 2 will hit theatres on January 23.

Will Emraan Hashmi's Taskaree return for Season 2? Director Raghav Jairath replies As Taskaree began streaming on Netflix, director Raghav Jairath shared in an exclusive conversation whether Season 2 is on the cards. He also opened up about his experience of working with Emraan Hashmi, Sharad Kelkar and others.

Ajith Kumar's beverage ad contradicts no film promotion policy, says social media Actor Ajith Kumar has endorsed a beverage ad for his racing team, breaking his long-standing no-promotion policy. This move has sparked mixed reactions online, highlighting debates about his dual career focus.

Ek Din: Junaid Khan-Sai Pallavi's film gets new release date, teaser on January 16 The poster of Junaid Khan and Sai Pallavi's upcoming romantic-drama 'Ek Din' was released by the production house. The film's new release date was also unveiled in the first look.

Suhana Khan cried alone in room, recalls rejection that changed her acting journey Suhana Khan, who made her acting debut in Zoya Akhtar's The Archies, opened up about her journey into acting, including a formative rejection in school that shaped her commitment to the craft.

Prime Video, JioHotstar, SonyLIV, ZEE5: 120 Bahadur, Kalamkaval and more This week's streaming releases bring a diverse mix of content across Prime Video, JioHotstar, SonyLIV and ZEE5, including the war drama 120 Bahadur, the dark police procedural Kalamkaval and a high-stakes heist thriller.

John Mayer's India debut delayed, fans express frustration. Check new date Fans of Grammy-winning artist John Mayer must wait until February for his first Mumbai show, as organisers postponed the concert previously planned for January 22, 2026, due to unforeseen circumstances.

Thalaivar 173: Rajinikanth shares new update on film with Cibi Chakravarthy Superstar Rajinikanth greeted fans on Pongal outside his Chennai residence and shared that filming for his next collaboration with director Cibi Chakravarthy under Raaj Kamal Films International will commence in April.

Bridgerton 4 world premiere: Benedict, Sophie get their Cinderella night in Paris Bridgerton Season 4 gets a glamorous Paris world premiere as the cast and creators mark the show's return later this month on Netflix.

Jailer 2: Vijay Sethupathi says I love Rajinikanth, confirms cameo Vijay Sethupathi has announced his cameo in the upcoming Tamil action-comedy Jailer 2, directed by Nelson Dilipkumar. The film, which features Rajinikanth reprising his role from the 2023 hit Jailer, is set to release in June 2026.

Laikey Laikaa: Abhay Verma-Rasha Thadani stun in raw, blood-stained first look The new posters of Abhay Verma and Rasha Thadani's 'Laikey Laikaa' have been unveiled. The film promises an intense, gritty romance.

Netflix this week: Agatha Christie's Seven Dials, The Rip and more Netflix is bringing a fresh lineup of shows and films this week, featuring an Agatha Christie mystery, a crime thriller starring Matt Damon and Ben Affleck, romances and a powerful true-crime documentary.

Pongal 2026: Rajinikanth meets fans; Kamal Haasan, Prabhu Deva share greetings On the occasion of Pongal, Rajinikanth met fans outside his residence to extend festive greetings. Actors including Kamal Haasan, Prabhu Deva, Suriya, Jr NTR, and others have extended their heartfelt Pongal wishes to fans nationwide.

Bigg Boss Kannada 12: Gilli, Ashwini, Dhanush—Who Will Take the Trophy? As Bigg Boss Kannada season 12 reaches its climax, the buzz around who will emerge as the winner has hit a peak. Among the remaining contestants, who will stand beside host Kichcha Sudeep with their hand raised at the end?

D54 update: Dhanush, Vignesh Raja film titled Kara, makers unveil gritty poster The makers of Dhanush's upcoming film, previously referred to as D54, have announced its official title. Titled Kara, it is directed by Vignesh Raja and backed by Vels Film International.

Go to High Court, Supreme Court tells Jana Nayagan makers seeking censor nod In the Jana Nayagan censor case, the Supreme Court rejected KVN Productions' plea and referred the makers to take the appeal back to the Madras High Court.

Suhana Khan says Shah Rukh and Gauri have the final say in her decisions Suhana Khan revealed her parents remain the final decision-makers in her career. Their contrasting advice helps her stay grounded as she embarks on her acting journey.

general news.headline: Come gather: ED cites WhatsApp chats to say TMC planned I-PAC hearing court chaosIn the chats accessed, a message circulated in the WhatsApp group "Legal Minds" read, "Everyone gather inside Court No. 5, Item No. 10." Soon after this clarion call for lawyers to assemble, another message was circulated urging everyone to join Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee's rally against the ED raids at the I-PAC premises.

Live: Probing videos showing marker pen ink removal, says State Election CommissionMaharashtra Civic Elections Live Updates: Voting is underway across Maharashtra for elections to 29 municipal corporations, with Mumbai firmly in focus. The BJP-led Mahayuti is facing a direct challenge from the reunited Thackeray cousins, Raj and Uddhav, in the high-stakes fight for control of the cash-rich Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation. Polling across the state began at 7.30 am and will continue till 5.30 pm for 2,869 seats across 893 wards. As many as 3.48 crore voters will choose from 15,931 candidates. In Mumbai alone, 1,700 candidates are contesting 227 Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) seats. The civic body, which has an annual budget exceeding Rs 74,400 crore, is going to the polls after a delay of four years. Follow indiatoday.in for all live updates.

Can men get pregnant? Senator grills Indian-origin doctor in heated abortion hearingSenator Josh Hawley repeatedly pressed Indian-American gynaecologist, Dr Nisha Verma, on whether men can get pregnant, highlighting a clash over biological facts. Verma emphasised patient diversity and avoided a direct yes-or-no answer.

Bangladesh Cricket Board sack director M Najmul Islam after players boycott BPLThe Bangladesh Cricket Board (BCB) on Thursday sacked director M Nazmul Islam, relieving him of all responsibilities, including his position as head of the finance committee, following demands from cricketers.

How BJP is trying to sink Mamata with her very own Singur scriptMonths before the 2026 Assembly elections in West Bengal, Mamata Banerjee's political nursery Singur has re-emerged as a flashpoint. The BJP has promised that it will bring Tata back to Singur, from where the company was forced to move to Gujarat after Mamata's movement in 2008. PM Narendra Modi is scheduled to address a rally in Singur on January 18, where farmers who had earlier protested, would be seated in the front row.

It's a bloodbath: Iranians, cut off from world, send SOS amid violent protestsIranian protesters, defying a week-long internet blackout, have sent out an SOS describing a brutal crackdown on anti-Khamenei protests, with security forces using lethal force and fear gripping streets and homes across the country.

Was meant for Shah Rukh: UP Minister walks back 'anti-national' Salman Khan rantUttar Pradesh's designated minister, Raghuraj Singh, withdrew his "anti-national" remark against Salman Khan, claiming it was a slip of the tongue.

Can Iran shut down the Strait of Hormuz, set oil prices on fire?Iran, which is seeing one of its biggest and deadliest protests since the 1979 Iranian Revolution, has been warned of military and economic action by US President Donald Trump. Such rhetoric, however, risks forcing Iran to use one of its most potent weapons, a blockade of the Strait of Hormuz, which could see oil prices spiral and hit major economies.

Suhana Khan says Shah Rukh and Gauri have the final say in her decisionsSuhana Khan revealed her parents remain the final decision-makers in her career. Their contrasting advice helps her stay grounded as she embarks on her acting journey.

Painful life or dignified death for Harish Rana? Order reserved in euthanasia caseHarish Rana, a resident of Delhi, sustained severe head injuries in 2013 after falling from the balcony of his PG accommodation. He has remained in a vegetative state ever since.

Supreme Court rules Tiger Global must pay tax on $1.6 billion Flipkart dealThe top court ruled that Tiger Global is not entitled to claim tax exemption under the India–Mauritius Double Taxation Avoidance Agreement (DTAA). It agreed with the Income Tax Department's view that the structure used for the transaction was aimed at avoiding tax liability in India.

Late Air India captain's pilot nephew summoned for crash probe, pilots protestThe Federation of Indian Pilots has raised objections to the summoning of Captain Varun Anand, nephew of the late Captain Sumeet Sabharwal, who piloted the Air India flight that crashed in Ahmedabad last year.

Shashi Tharoor is a Swiftie. Of course it was OpheliaCongress MP Shashi Tharoor has once again gone viral after sharing an Instagram video of himself vibing to Taylor Swift's 'The Fate of Ophelia' during a brief break from work, delighting Swifties and fans alike.

Live: Iran's judiciary says protester sentenced to death won't be executedIran Protests Live Updates: The death toll from nationwide protests in Iran has crossed 2,600 on Wednesday as Iranians were able to make phone calls abroad for the first time in days after authorities cut communications during a sweeping crackdown. The protests, which began more than two weeks ago over the country's struggling economy, have since broadened into direct opposition to the ruling theocracy, including Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei. Iranian state television issued its first indirect acknowledgement of the scale of the deaths, saying the country had suffered a lot of martyrs. While US President Donald Trump urged Iranians to keep protesting, saying help was on the way. Stay tuned to indiatoday.in for all the latest updates.
India's best bar is not from Delhi or Mumbai. It is from...The 30 Best Bars in India unveiled the winners of its sixth edition at an awards ceremony held in Goa earlier this week.

Why marker pens and not ink? Opposition alleges fraud in Maharashtra civic polls Live UpdatesA political row has erupted in Maharashtra civic polls over the use of marker pens instead of indelible ink to mark voters, with the opposition alleging the practice could enable electoral fraud.

First view of four Nasa Crew-11 astronauts evacuated from spaceThe historic medical evacuation of the Crew-11 team concluded safely with a Pacific Ocean splashdown today. Experts are now evaluating the astronauts following their 167-day mission aboard the station.

Why Mumbai won't be voting for Marathi language politics todayMumbai evolved into a melting pot of cultures decades ago, but identity politics keeps resurfacing every poll season, with BMC polls being the latest trigger. Here's why clinging to linguistic pride is not only disconnected from Mumbai's dynamics today but is also absurd.

Pause FIRs, protect CCTV of I-PAC raid: Supreme Court blow to Mamata BanerjeeThe Supreme Court issued notice to the West Bengal government on a plea filed by the ED against Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee over the alleged obstruction of the agency's search at the office of political consultancy firm I-PAC, which works for the Trinamool Congress.

Bharat Taxi app rides now rolling out to compete with Uber and OlaBharat Taxi, a new cooperative cab app service, is rolling out in cities like Delhi-NCR. While the official launch is expected in the next few weeks, the app has received major interface update and is now increasingly available for both drivers and riders.

It brings forth how human egos affect the lives of their loved ones.

Percentile vs percentage: What is the difference and how is each calculatedAs NEET PG counselling resumes following a sharp revision in qualifying cut-offs, many aspirants are struggling to understand what the lowered percentile actually means. Here's a simple explainer of how percentile works, how it differs from percentage, and why it matters for NEET PG seat allocation.

Fatty liver is a metabolic disease, not an alcohol problem, doctors warnNon-alcoholic fatty liver disease is the leading chronic liver disease affecting many non-drinkers in India. Early detection and lifestyle changes are crucial to prevent serious liver and heart complications.

Air India plane hit by foreign object, suffers engine damage after return to DelhiAir India stated that a foreign object was encountered while taxiing in dense fog, detailing that the right engine of the aircraft was affected.

sports.headline: Bangladesh Cricket Board sack director M Najmul Islam after players boycott BPL Bangladesh Cricket Board sack director M Najmul Islam after players boycott BPL

Mehidy Hasan slams BCB director over bizarre remarks: Shameful, inappropriate Mehidy Hasan Miraz slammed BCB director M. Najmul Islam's "shameful" remarks on player compensation, triggering backlash from cricketers and boycott threats amid Bangladesh's T20 World Cup uncertainty.

India's Henil Patel wreaks havoc with sensational five-wicket haul vs USA India made a thunderous start to their ICC Under-19 World Cup campaign as Henil Patel spearheaded a ruthless bowling performance with a five-wicket haul to dismantle the USA for a paltry 107 in 35.2 overs on Thursday.

Nitish faces trolls, but finds backing from former India batter after Rajkot ODI Former India batter Hanuma Vihari has jumped to the defence of Nitish Kumar Reddy after the all-rounder was trolled on social media, following his performance in the Rajkot ODI. Nitish didn't have a big role to play in the second match as New Zealand levelled the series.

How Daryl Mitchell prepared for India's white-ball tour in New Zealand India vs New Zealand: Batting mainstay Daryl Mitchell said training at New Zealand Cricket's marquee pitch facility in Lincoln helped him adapt to spin-friendly subcontinent conditions.

Bangladesh issue showcause to director as players revolt sees BPL game delayed Bangladesh cricket remains in turmoil as players' revolt sees a BPL game get delayed with both teams yet to reach the stadium. The Bangladesh cricket board has issued a showcase notice to director Najmul Islam, whom the players want out of the organisation.

IND vs USA live score: Suryavanshi departs cheaply in 108 chase IND vs USA U-19 World Cup live score: After a rain delay, India have got their run chase underway in Bulawayo. Mhatre and Suryavanshi are at the crease and will be looking to get things rolling in the short run chase.

Australian Open: Sinner, Djokovic on course for semi-final showdown Jannik Sinner and Novak Djokovic are on course for a mouth-watering semi-final showdown at the Australian Open after the draw was revealed at Melbourne Park on Thursday.

Winless UP Warriorz seek revival against in-form Mumbai Indians WPL 2026, MIW vs UPW Preview: UP Warriorz, still searching for their first win of the season, come into the match after a seven-wicket defeat to Delhi Capitals. Mumbai Indians, meanwhile, beat Gujarat Giants in their previous outing and have enjoyed a day's rest ahead of the clash.

Mohammad Rizwan should leave Big Bash League and return to Pakistan: Former batter Kamran Akmal has called on Mohammad Rizwan to leave the Big Bash League due to his disappointing performance. The call highlights the pressure on Rizwan as he struggles to adapt to fast-paced T20 cricket and faces an uncertain future in Pakistan's T20 squad.

Daryll Mitchell continues to haunt India: Rajkot ODI adds to list of fruitful knock Daryl Mitchell struck another commanding century to haunt India yet again, guiding New Zealand to victory in Rajkot. His growing dominance against India now reads like a pattern rather than a coincidence.

T20 World Cup: England's preparations disrupted as Rashid, Ahmed await visasEngland's preparations for the T20 World Cup 2026 have been disrupted as spinners Adil Rashid and Rehan Ahmed face visa delays from India. They are set to tour Sri Lanka for a white-ball series ahead of the tournament.

Virat Kohli's priceless reaction as fan jumps barricades to meet him in RajkotDuring the second ODI at Rajkot, a fan breached security to meet Virat Kohli, who embraced him warmly. Despite Rahul's century, New Zealand chased down the target, leveling the series and setting up a thrilling decider.

Why Vaibhav Suryavanshi doesn't need the U19 World CupMost cricketers use the U19 World Cup to announce themselves. Vaibhav Suryavanshi arrives already battle-hardened, having faced the IPL, senior domestic cricket and international-quality bowling before turning 15.

India Open badminton: After pigeon-droppings, monkey spotted at Delhi stadiumA monkey was spotted inside the spectator gallery at the India Open badminton tournament. The incident has raised questions about venue security and playing conditions amid ongoing criticism.

Jallikattu 2026: Pramod Madhav On Strict Rules As 1,000 Bulls Enter The ArenaOn this Special Report, India Today Senior Correspondent Pramod Madhav reports from the ground as the traditional bull-taming sport, Jallikattu, begins in Tamil Nadu. Marking the commencement of the Pongal harvest season, the event in Avaniapuram features 1,000 registered bulls and 600 bull tamers. Madhav notes that 'No kind of any chemicals or drugs should not be used either by the bull tamer or on the bulls,' highlighting the strict medical tests and safety norms enforced following Supreme Court interventions. The report details the technicalities of the sport, where tamers must hold onto the bull's hump through the 'vadi vasal' entrance. As the state celebrates the harvest festival, the programme explores the cultural and spiritual significance of this annual athletic tradition, which remains a matter of deep faith for the people of Tamil Nadu.

U19 World Cup 2026: Know the names beyond Vaibhav SuryavanshiIndia's U19 squad for the 2026 World Cup features a balanced mix of batting, bowling, and all‑round talent beyond Vaibhav Suryavanshi. With leaders like Vihaan Malhotra and versatile players, India look well-equipped to challenge for a sixth title.

U19 World Cup: India favourites, but can Pakistan, Bangladesh spring surprises?The U19 World Cup 2026 is all set to begin in Zimbabwe and Namibia, with India looking like favourites ahead of the tournament. However, Ayush Mhatre and Co. will have some competition this time around en route to their sixth title.

IND vs NZ: India assistant coach wants better show from spinners after Rajkot ODI lossIndia's spin bowling came under sharp focus after the Rajkot ODI loss, with assistant coach Ryan ten Doeschate admitting the execution was below par. Daryl Mitchell's composed century exposed those flaws as New Zealand levelled the series.

India suffer T20 World Cup scare as Washington Sundar ruled out of NZ T2OIsIndia's T20 World Cup preparations face fresh uncertainty as Washington Sundar is ruled out of the New Zealand T20Is, adding to selection worries with Tilak Varma's fitness also under a cloud.

Bangladesh cricketers threaten boycott after director's controversial remarksThe Bangladesh cricketers have threatened boycott unless director Najmul Islam resigns after his controversial comments on Wednesday, January 14. Najmul questioned the commitment of the players on Wednesday.

Nervous Delhi Capitals survive UP Warriorz scare to open account in WPL 2026WPL 2026, DC vs UPW: Jemimah Rodrigues' Delhi Capitals opened their account in the tournament after beating Meg Lanning's UP Warriorz by seven wickets on Wednesday in Navi Mumbai.

India's sloppy fielding in Rajkot rings alarm bells ahead of T20 World CupIndia's sloppy fielding in the Rajkot ODI has triggered concern ahead of the T20 World Cup. Captain Shubman Gill admitted missed chances are costing games, putting the spotlight firmly on India's defensive standards.

Bangladesh players won't be compensated if T20 World Cup is boycotted: BCBBCB finance chief M. Nazmul Islam said Bangladesh players, not the board, would bear the financial hit if the team pulls out of the T20 World Cup amid ongoing uncertainty over participation in India.

Ro-Ko misfire, weak bowling haunt India as New Zealand level series in RajkotDaryl Mitchell's hundred and a poor day at the office for India meant that New Zealand levelled the series on Wednesday, January 14 in Rajkot. KL Rahul's 112 went in vain as India's batting collapsed once again.

ISL boat still leaking: Kerala Blasters lose 3rd foreigner in 2 weeks after delayIND vs NZ: Kerala Blasters parted ways with Juan Rodriguez minutes after confirming ISL participation under the new format. The move underlined the club's reset after shutting operations during months of league uncertainty.

India badminton chief slams Antonsen: Can't comment while sitting in DenmarkBAI secretary general Sanjay Mishra hit back at Anders Antonsen's criticism of India Open conditions, rejecting claims made from abroad. The Indian body insisted standards were met and politics had no place in sport.

KL Rahul is India's crisis man, like Rahul Dravid once was: Sunil GavaskarIND vs NZ: Sunil Gavaskar has hailed KL Rahul as India's modern-day ODI crisis man after his unbeaten 112 in Rajkot. The comparison with Rahul Dravid underlines Rahul's growing importance at No. 5.

PV Sindhu finds no issues with India Open conditions amid hygiene claimsIndia's star badminton player PV Sindhu said that she found the playing conditions at the Indira Gandhi Indoor Stadium to be fine amid the hygiene row surrounding the India Open. The conditions in Delhi was questioned by Anders Antonsen and Mia Blichfeldt.

DC vs UPW Highlights: Delhi Capitals open account with 7-wicket winDelhi Capitals Women (MI) vs UP Warriorz Women (GG) Highlights: Delhi Capitals (DC) looked rusty on the night but eventually found a way to open their account in the Women's Premier League (WPL) 2026. On Wednesday, January 14, the Capitals edged past the UP Warriorz by seven wickets in Match No. 7 at the Dr DY Patil Sports Academy, Navi Mumbai

Delhi Air 'Not Safe': Danish Shuttler Pulls Out Of India Open Citing Delhi's 'Poisonous' AirThis news bulletin addresses the alarming levels of air pollution in Delhi and its impact on international sporting events. A prominent Danish badminton player has withdrawn from the India Open, citing hazardous air quality in the national capital. The speaker notes that the athlete's decision was not based on injury or scheduling but on the fact that the 'air in the national capital is simply not safe.' The programme highlights the embarrassment of a global sporting event being deemed unfit for athletes due to breathing risks. The shuttler reportedly stated that Delhi is 'not the place to host tournaments under such conditions,' a comment the speaker describes as an indictment of years of apathy and inaction. The report concludes by calling the situation a national shame, as the city's air turns poisonous every winter, posing a daily risk to residents and now deterring international competitors.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
